intro: Thlaspi elegans, commonly known as glossy bladderwort, is a small flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, glossy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a raceme. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows, along stream banks, and in damp woodlands. Thlaspi elegans is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards.
